Description: Preparatory drawing showing the army marching past the King of Egypt, for illustration to Canto XVIII of 'La Gerusalemme Liberata di Torquato Tasso' Paris (Didot) 1784; bearded turbaned figure seated above a crowd with unicorns and armed figures. c.1784 Black chalk squared for transfer
Producer name: Drawn by: Charles Nicolas Cochin fils
Curator's comments: 'La Gerusalemme Liberata di Torquato Tasso' published by Didot in Paris 1784, contained a frontispiece and 40 plates after C.N. Cochin, fils. See Henri Cohen, 'Guide de l'Amateur de livres à Gravures au XVIII siècle', 1912, 976-7, and Ruth S.Kraemer, 'Drawings by CNC for Monsieur's Gerusalemme Liberata', in 'Master Drawings', XXXI 1993, pp.146-62.
Associated titles: La Gerusalemme Liberata di Torquato Tasso
Acquisition notes: This drawing is part of a large collection of XVIII century French book illustrations from the Fürstenberg and Schäfer collections; most are proof states of prints designed as illustrations (1997,0928.73 and following). The collection also included 16 drawings (1997,0927.7 to 22); the group was not offered at the Schäfer sale at Sotheby's in 1996 and was offered through Sotheby's by Mr Schäfer to the BM.
